item.title: Stephanie M. Lee
item.description: SCOOP: You may recall that in 2021, a famous study about honesty got retracted due to fraudulent data (ironic).But that wasn't the end of the story. An author now tells me that per a Harvard investigation, the study had even more fraudulent data than previously revealed ... https://www.chronicle.com/article/a-weird-research-misconduct-scandal-about-dishonesty-just-got-weirder

item.title: Cheshire
item.description:
Dictatorship? How Hitler, Stalin and Trump show it’s easier than you think
https://www.theguardian.com/books/2023/jun/17/dictatorship-hitler-stalin-trump-chalupa-kendzior-book-interview?CMP=Share_AndroidApp_Other
#ChalupaKendzior

item.title: Kevin Russell
item.description: President Carter, now in his last days, home to be with his family as he passes, once personally saved Ottawa from a Nuclear Disaster, at risk, and cost, to his life, suffering from radiation poisoning all his life.Canada had a Nuclear Accident in the 50s, asked the US for help, Lieutenant Jimmy Carter lead a team out of NY.The future President Carter, had his team lower him into the reactor.I had no ideaI have no idea why this isn't widely known.https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/chalk-river-nuclear-accident-1.6293574

item.title: Teixi
item.description:
@emilygorcenski Similarly just listened @kordinglab about how having more real data beats bayesian stats, general purpose algos beats `my model` approaches... ;)Aka: The Bitter Lesson in ML!~54 min.
https://learnbayesstats.com/episode/84-causality-neuroscience-psychology-konrad-kording/

item.title: Prof. Mayank R Mehta, UCLA
item.description: Brenda Milner did a lot more pioneering work than you'd guess (see article). Remarkably, most of it is still useful after 60+ years! She will be 105 on July 15. Award committees, now is your chance to recognize her pioneering work and send her a great birthday gift.https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fnhum.2021.786167/full

item.title: MaggieCi
item.description: a salad-related tale

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Must read for anybody interested in data forensics. Excel spreadsheets (unsurprisingly) contain a mass of historical information. If the data were tampered with in the same file, there may well be a trace.I suspect a few applications of this sort of analysis will be showing up on PubPeer soon.https://datacolada.org/109

item.title: Keith Devlin
item.description: #Brexit insanity. This looks like pure spite. She is my age (76) and the UK was her home since she was 2 years of age. What the hell has gone wrong with my home country? https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2023/jun/17/norwegian-roxy-music-album-cover-star-kari-ann-moller-fights-to-stay-in-uk-post-brexit

item.title: Zack Labe
item.description:
So much heat. Temperature anomalies over the last three months:🟥 - warmer than average
🟦 - colder than averageQuestions about GISTEMPv4 and the baseline (1951-1980): https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/faq/. Code for the data: https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/sources_v4/

item.title: Scott Stedman
item.description: Saud al-Qahtani’s public reappearance, with hugs and kisses from Bin Salman’s inner circle, should give every American official pushing for rapprochement with Saudi Arabia pause. Al-Qahtani was the mastermind and intelligence chief of the Khashoggi assassination. The celebration of his return from nearly 5 years of hiding is disgusting, cruel, and a gigantic F you to to Blinken, who just left Saudi Arabia last week.

item.title: Thiago Carvalho
item.description: "For at least two centuries, scientists have been enthralled by the “zombie” behaviors induced by mind-controlling parasites. Despite this interest, the mechanistic bases of these uncanny processes have remained mostly a mystery."https://elifesciences.org/articles/85410

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: I've never understood how the standard French mortgage has a fixed rate for its duration whereas in the home of fintech (the UK) such an offering is impossible.https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2023/jun/18/millions-are-facing-soaring-mortgage-rates-how-did-we-leave-them-so-vulnerable

item.title: Mackenzie Mathis 🦄
item.description:
🚨Crowded scenes are notoriously difficult for #ComputerVision models.
In our new work lead by PhD students Mu Zhou & Lucas Stoffl we developed a novel approach called BUCTD that is state-of-the-art on crowded 🐒🐠&🕺human pose estimation benchmarks!🔥
Http://arxiv.org/abs/2306.07879
#CVPR2023 workshop

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Oh. I just realised that Robert F. Kennedy Jr is running for the *Democratic* nomination. Is his plan then to switch to being independent and drag as many voters as possible with him?

item.title: Alex Holcombe
item.description:
Big publishers' journals are not to be admired.Meta-psychology and a few other scholar-led journals do computational reproducibility checks of all submissions.
Do ANY non-scholar-led journals (e.g., owned by the big publishers) do this?
If not, I rest my case! 😆
